conclusion: The wires are of equal length and resistance, forming an equilateral triangle.
The equilateral-triangle sides AC, CB, and base AB each carry the same current I.
Each straight side in a uniform, perpendicular magnetic field B experiences an Ampere force F = I L B.
The direction of the Ampere force is given by the right-hand rule.
The force on side AB is stated to be F in magnitude.
The two oblique sides form 60° angles with AB, so the forces on AC and CB have the same magnitude F and are symmetrically oriented 60° above AB.
Adding the three vector forces (F on AB horizontally, and two forces of the same magnitude F making 60° with it) gives complete cancellation.
The horizontal components cancel pair-wise and the vertical components cancel as well.
Resultant Ampere force on the whole triangular frame is 0.
